page.title: 19Two Bridges in General
page.content:
The Eastern half of the area is relatively flat and devoid of any striking natural features. The Western area is deeply disected by the West Dart River, running North-South between Beardown Tors and Littaford Tors; the sides of the valley are covered by light clitter. To the East is the ancient Wistman's Wood, and to the West is the slope of Beardown Hill contoured by the Devonport Leat.
The land to the South of the road is almost wholly given over to enclosed rough grazing in contrast to the Northern area which is natural open moorland.
One small forest plantation has been developed on the Southern slope of Beardown Hill, just North of Two Bridges.
